4 import rospy
5 import uarm_msgs.msg
6 from uarm_msgs.srv import *
7 from std_srvs.srv import *
8 import actionlib
9 import time

13 #call uarm_move service
14 
15 
28 
29 
30 
31 #create ROS action client:
32 #CLIENT-NAME = actionlib.SimpleActionClient(TOPIC NAME, TYPE OF MESSAGE)
33 client = actionlib.SimpleActionClient('uarm1/uarm_move', uarm_msgs.msg.uarm_moveAction)
34 
35 
36 #start node
37 rospy.init_node('uarm1_client', anonymous=True)
38 
39 
42 
43 #publishes goal for uarm and waits until it is reached
44 
45 def move_client(x, y, z):
46 
47  print("connecting")
48  # Waits until the action server has started up and started
49  # listening for goals.
50  client.wait_for_server()
51  print("connected")
52 
53  # Creates a goal to send to the action server.
54  goal = uarm_msgs.msg.uarm_moveGoal(x=x,y=y,z=z)
55  print("goal defined")
56 
57  # Sends the goal to the action server.
58  client.send_goal(goal)
59  print("goal sent")
60 
61  # Waits for the server to finish performing the action.
62  client.wait_for_result()
63 
64  #gets the result of the task
65  return client.get_result()
66 
67 
68 
69 
70 #publishes service request to change the state of the pump of the vacuum gripper
71 def pump(pump_state):
72  rospy.wait_for_service('uarm1/uarm_set_pump')
73  print("connected")
74  try:
75  service_object = rospy.ServiceProxy('uarm1/uarm_set_pump', uarm_pump)
76  received_response = service_object(pump_state)
77  print("service called")
78  return received_response.success
79  except:
80  print("service call failed")
81  return(False)
